.

> (lists, or other simple container classes, a calculator, etc..).   
> Bu=
t my "real classes" are written for my "real application" and as
> such the=
re is an entire environment that is created as they work

ng the classes in isolation seems next to impossible.

 be quick to jump in and say that this must be a

 my design.. my classes shouldn't be so

hing similar.    In some (trivial)
> cases it is possible to write stand al=
one classes, and they are

to work

 to

Do you know w=
ww.mockobjects.com ?
Have your classes depend on interfaces (and not on oth=
er classes)
and implement the interfaces with mock objects.

This should he=
lp to make test setup more easy.

You may want to have a look at 
http://ww=

http://www.objectmentor.com/publicati=
ons/oodmetrc.pdf

s

so IMHO it is much more that a hype.

t difficult or impossible to test some 
functionality of my classes. I real=
ized that I could easily extract such

h
responsability into a specific class.
